thread.title: Our first look at Universal's Halloween Horror Nights
thread.title_full: Our first look at Universal's Halloween Horror Nights

author: Dewayne Bevil
title: Our first look at Universal's Halloween Horror Nights
text:
Jack The Clown returns to Halloween Horror Nights 
Jack the Clown makes his appearance at Halloween Horror Nights. 
Jack the Clown makes his appearance at Halloween Horror Nights. Universal goes back to year one for HHN25 
This year’s edition of Halloween Horror Nights will have the most haunted houses, most scareactors, most event nights of any of in the 25-year history of the Universal Studios event. After Tuesday night’s media preview, here are five most intriguing elements. Caption Halloween Horror Nights 25 Ricardo Ramirez Buxeda / Orlando Sentinel Asylum In Wonderland 3D -- Halloween Horror Nights 25 media preview at Universal Orlando, on Tuesday, September 8, 2015. (Ricardo Ramirez Buxeda / Orlando Sentinel) Asylum In Wonderland 3D -- Halloween Horror Nights 25 media preview at Universal Orlando, on Tuesday, September 8, 2015. (Ricardo Ramirez Buxeda / Orlando Sentinel) (Ricardo Ramirez Buxeda / Orlando Sentinel) Caption Halloween Horror Nights 25 Ricardo Ramirez Buxeda / Orlando Sentinel Jack Presents 25 Years of Monsters & Mayhem -- Halloween Horror Nights 25 media preview at Universal Orlando, on Tuesday, September 8, 2015. (Ricardo Ramirez Buxeda / Orlando Sentinel) Jack Presents 25 Years of Monsters & Mayhem -- Halloween Horror Nights 25 media preview at Universal Orlando, on Tuesday, September 8, 2015. (Ricardo Ramirez Buxeda / Orlando Sentinel) (Ricardo Ramirez Buxeda / Orlando Sentinel) See more galleries 
1. Guests will get a history lesson in the maze called Jack Presents: 25 Years of Monsters and Mayhem. “We have something representative from every year, starting with the very first room you walk into,” says Charles Gray, show director for the houses. In case you can’t flash back to 1991: “In year one, we had a lot of pumpkins and we had a chainsaw going through a pumpkin in the very first banner.” Grays says there will plenty of Easter eggs inside the maze and all three versions of our host, Jack the Clown.
